name: mandala workshops for groups and individuals
description:
Facilitated by a fully qualified Art Therapist.  HPC registered and CRB checked. 

Get in touch with your spirituality.  A workshop designed to enable connection with the right side of the brain.  All materials provided.  Suitable for adults and children of all ages.

A novel team building exercise or general group bonding.

Length of time full (4 hours with mid break)
or half day (2 hours).

£50 per person
Group rates vary
Travel expenses extra

name: Dropped ceiling
description: I also do commision work.  Here is an example of a dropped ceiling that i made for my once-boring small bathroom.  Pendant light fitting replace by long fluorescent tube lighting for maximum behind light.  Circular shapes cut out using electric jig-saw.  Materials for circles originated from SCRAP.  Again, influenced by the mandala.  Over the last few years, the discovery and process of creating mandala patterns is having a big impression on me.  Particularly since my visit to India in winter 2010.  A highly recommended website created by American artist Bailey Cunningham www.mandalaproject.org I use mandala workshops in my practice as an Art Therapist.  Price on request.  Fee £10.00.

name: solid pine sideboard
description: Most recent piece (and not quite finished) - non-traditional solid pine sideboard, entitled "Happiness".  Again, influenced by the mandala with a basic theme of 1970's retrospective colours.  Inside cupboard painted in skiprat burgundy (as are all pieces....underneath and backsides).  Drawer inserts and cupboard shelf covered in wrapping paper, courtesy of Leeds SCRAP www,scrapstuff.co.uk.   Paints supplied by Seagulls - reused paint supplies, Leeds www.seagullsreuse.org.uk.  Sideboard situated at FullCircle Bespoke Design Emporium also of Leeds.

name: Witches table
description:
A treasure table of mystical wonder and magical delights.  Non-symmetrical mandala pattern displayed on table top.  Primary colours in greens the colour of the heart chakara.  Sparkles and buttons prevail.....a common woman's jewels.  The table has 3 spindle legs and grounds very sturdily. 

Big influence from the art of mandala...ancient Sanskrit  meaning 'circle'.

name: Table and 2 chairs
description:
Tribute to Meret Oppenheim entitled 
"Come Dine With Me Meret Oppenheim"
My piece is a feux leopard skin and painted dining set for two.  It is also recycled furniture and has lovingly been restored into a collectable and practical piece of kitsch artwork.  A lovely contrast to beechwood veneered gluewood.
Unique furniture....one of its kind.
